page.title: 16ST. MICHAEL'S CHURCH
page.content: St. Michael's church is 160 years old, but there has been a church on the site since before 1044. The vicar of the church today is the Rev. Philip Luff and he is the only full-time worker in the church. He holds nine services every week which included three on Sundays. The church will hold at least 500 people, but the congregation added together for the three services on Sundays averages 300 people. The choir of the church has about 20 people including children. Local schools and other organisations take part in several carol concerts that are held at Christmas time and the Flower Festival is a popular event during the summer. The church costs about Â£20,000 a year to run which includes the cost of the heating and lighting.
